elements.name: question1
elements.title: Why do retailers accept credit cards?
elements.correctAnswer: They are hoping for more sales as a result.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: How does the process of paying by credit card work?
elements.correctAnswer: The buyer confirms that she is the cardholder by entering her PIN. By entering the PIN, she also confirms that she agrees to the transaction. With contactless payment, no PIN entry is required for amounts under CHF 80. The retailer receives online approval for the amount to be charged from the relevant credit card organization. In rare cases, the cardholder's signature is required instead of entering the PIN. In this case, the original purchase receipt remains with the seller, while the credit card organization and the buyer each receive a copy. Billing usually takes place at the end of the month.

elements.name: question7
elements.title: Why do retailers use loyalty cards?
elements.correctAnswer: Retailers hope to increase sales, gain an insight into their customers' shopping habits and save the commission that is charged on credit cards.

elements.name: question8
elements.title: What is the difference between a loyalty card and a credit card?
elements.correctAnswer: A customer card with a credit function is issued by the retailer and is only accepted as a means of payment in their stores. In contrast, major credit cards are accepted by most retailers.

elements.name: question9
elements.title: Where do you see the advantages and disadvantages of a customer card for retailers?
elements.correctAnswer:
Advantages: Turnover (additional customers), no risk of theft, no counterfeit money, generation of customer data, no commission fees;
Disadvantages: Credit risk, loss of interest, administrative effort
